syllabus:
Spring 2022

This course offers an introduction to the development of literature in Western civilization with a focus on the characters and stories of the Ancient Greece and the Bible. It examines major themes and developments that have had significant impact on the Western literary tradition. It also aims to familiarize students with the significant religious, historical and social events that have shaped early Western society and literature.

**_Objectives_**: The main goals of the course are the following:

1.  to familiarize students with the main themes of Greek mythology, Greek drama, early Christian writings;
2.  to enable them to compare and contrast significant characters, events, symbols;
3.  familiarize students with the historical and cultural background of the texts studied
4.  to give students some familiarity with the visual arts that depict the Bible and legends of Ancient Greece.

 _**Course requirements**_ 

Students are expected to be familiar with the required readings _prior_ to class discussions. Students will be graded on the basis of (1) their active participation in the class discussions and on Moodle—60%, (2) a midterm & final test—40%.

**Week 1** **Introduction & General Background**

**Week 2 The Trojan Saga and the _Iliad_**

Readings: _Mythology_, “The Heroes of the Trojan War,” 178-202 Homer, _The Iliad_, Book I, VI, VIII, IX, 189-232

**Week 3 _The_ _Iliad –_ continued**

Readings: Homer, _The Iliad_, Book XVI, XVIII, XXII, XXIV, 232-291.

**Week 4** **The Returns and the _Odyssey_**

Readings: _Mythology_, “The Adventures of Odysseus,” 291-320; _Norton_, Homer, _Odyssey,_ Book I, ii, ix & xxi, xxii, xxiii, xxiv

**Week 5 The Theban Saga**

Readings: _Mythology_, “The Royal House of Thebes,” 254-261. Sophocles, _Oedipus the King_, 666-706. Aristotle, handout

**Week 6** **The Theban Saga continued & Greek Tragedy**

Readings: Sophocles, _Oedipus the King_, 666-706.

**Week 7 Greek Tragedy**

Readings: Sophocles, _Antigone_

**Week 8 Mid term**

**Week 9 Greek Tragedy, _Medeea_**

Readings: _Mythology,_ “The Quest of the Golden Fleece,” 117-131;  Euripides, _Medea_ 690-720.

**Week 10 Greek Comedy**

Aristophanes, _Lysistrata_

**Week 11** **Greek Philosophy**,

Plato _The Apology of Socrates_ & _Symposium_ (excerpts)

**Week 12** **Roman** **Mythology**

Readings: _Mythology_, “Roman Gods,” 46-51, “The Adventures of Aeneas,” 320-335, _Norton,_ Virgil, _The Aeneid_, Book I, IV, 98-1002, 1025-1044.

**Week 13-14 The Hebrew Bible. The Old Testament**

**Week 15 The Bible: The New Testament**

Readings: Luke 2 \[The Birth and Youth of Jesus\], Matthew 5-7 \[The Teaching of Jesus: The Sermon on the Mount\], Luke 15 \[Parables\], Matthew 13 \[Why Jesus Teaches in Parables\], Matthew 27-28 \[The Trial and Crucifixion of Jesus\], John I \[The Word\] 1152-1166.

**Week 16 Final Exam**
